column4: Hi. I am having trouble connecting to an external hard drive that is connected to a wireless router. My room mates have no problem connecting to it, and I can see it in "places->Network", but when I double click, I can't see any of the files that are stored on it, or write to it at all. But the thing is, when I plug the external hard drive into my machine via usb, I can read and write without any problems. I am using ubuntu 9.10, and i
t is a nexstar GX external hard drive. Anyone have any ideas?
can you connect to the drive with smb://hostname or smb://ipaddress in your file manager? (assuming you are using gnome)
When I connect in places->network, the file name is smb://base-station-1.local/   (base-station-1 is the name of the device), but I'm not sure how to determine the ip address.
to find out the ip address open a terminal and type 'nnblookup base-station-1'
nnblookup isn't a command for me.
nmblookup worked.
yeah sorry it's nmblookup, I typed that wrong.
Ok cool.
did you get the IP?
Gave me two different ips.
try smb://ip in your file manager first, with both of the ips, se we can determine if lookuping up the netbios name is the problem or not
so*
Ihmm..where is file manager
open your home folder
Both ips took me nowhere.
0 files
(items)
are you on the same workgroup as the windows share?
I'm not sure. I think it is a mac share though. I moved in here, both the current residents have macs, and their dad set up the network, and it is a mac router.
Is there an easy way to determine what workgroup I am on?
yes /etc/samba/smb.conf lookfor 'workgroup = ...'
the first step would be to determine if you can mount the share with smbmount however, to see if it gives you a more verbose error.
sorry but I have to go afk for some dinner, will be back after.. but I am sure there is someone else that can assist you.
